get.description: Returns web notifications for the current user.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size 1..n. Number of web notifications per page

link.description: Links to the first, last, prev, and next page

total-size.description: The total number of web notifications

unread-size.description: The total number of unread web notifications

400.description: If page or pageSize contains invalid values

delete.description: Hides all web notifications for the current user.

head.description: Returns the total and unread size of web notifications for the current user.

total-size.description: The total number of web notifications

unread-size.description: The total number of unread web notifications

patch.description: Marks all web notifications for the current user as read.

get.description: Returns the web notification for the current user with the given uuid

delete.description: Hides the web notification for the current user and the given uuid.

patch.description: Marks the web notification for the current user and the given uuid as read.

get.description: Returns the version and the name of the engine

parameters.name: agg
parameters.description:
The aggregation query to make bucket (grouping) or metric aggregations like average, max, min or, sum.
You can cluster cases in buckets, as deep as you like, and optionally a metric as a terminal operation on such buckets.

${field1}:${operation1}:${payload1},${field2}:${operation2}:${payload2},${fieldX}:${operationX}:${payloadX}

All available fields:
- state (string)
- businessState (string)
- priority (string)
- category (string)
- stage (string)
- isBusinessCase (bool)
- creator.name (string)
- businessRuntime (number)
- workingTime (number)
- startTimestamp (date)
- modifiedTimestamp (date)
- endTimestamp (date)
- customFields.strings.* (string)
- customFields.numbers.* (number)
- customFields.timestamps.* (datetime)
- owners.name (string)

Available operations for string fields:
- bucket

Available operations for bool fields:
- bucket

Available operations for datetime fields:
- bucket:interval (interval: year, month, week, day, hour [default: day])
- max
- min
- avg

Available operations for number fields:
- bucket:interval (interval: number [default: 1])
- max
- min
- avg
- sum

Limitations:
In a query,
- You can use a field only once.
- A metrics (avg, max, min, sum) needs to be the last operation.
- You can use one metric aggregation only once.

Result:
- A bucket contains always a 'key' and a 'count'. It may contain sub-aggregations with sub-buckets or metrics.
- A metric contains just a 'value' as a string.
- Datetime strings are always in ISO 8601 format e.g., 2023-02-15T13:06:42Z

Business State Buckets.description: Aggregates cases into business state buckets.

Start Timestamp Buckets.description: Aggregates cases into startTimestamp buckets with the default interval of 'day'.

Start Timestamp Buckets and Business Sta.description: Aggregates cases into startTimestamp buckets with the interval of 'month' and into business state sub-buckets.

Average Start Timestamp.description: Average start time stamp of all cases.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filter to limit the cases on which the aggregation is performed. You can
filter by multiple fields at once. Each expression is AND connected.

${field1}:${expression1},${field2}:${expression2},${fieldX}:${expressionX}

e.g.
- businessState:DONE,creator.name:alex,numberOfResumes:>5

For string fields, you can use multiple values which (separated by a space) are OR connected, e.g.:
- businessState:DONE DESTROYED

You can make range filters for datetime and number fields with <, >, >= and <=. Datetimes must
be formatted in ISO 8601 format, e.g.:
- businessRuntime:>5 <10
- businessRuntime:>=5
- businessRuntime:<=10
- startTimestamp:>2023-02-15T13:06:42Z

Additionally, to the fields that are supported in the agg parameter, you can also use all fields supported
by the agg parameter of the /worfklow/task/stats resources. Those parameters are only available for filtering
but not for aggregation. They need to be prefixed with 'tasks.', e.g.:
- tasks.state
- tasks.worker.name
- tasks.customFields.strings.*
- ...

Additional filter tasks.canWorkOn:[memberName]
tasks.canWorkOn is an additional filter that is only available for filtering but not for aggregation.
If you don't specify a memberName then the canWorkOn filter will be applied to the current user session,
otherwise to the given memberName. The memberName of the role is the role name itself e.g. Everybody.
The memberName of a user is a hashtag # followed by the user name e.g. #alex.

Limitations:
- If you use the tasks.canWorkOn filter for a user, then you can not specify a filter for tasks.state and tasks.worker.name.
- If you use the tasks.canWorkOn filter for a role, then you can not specify a filter for tasks.state and tasks.responsibles.name.
- You can provide only one member (user or role).

e.g:
- tasks.canWorkOn
- tasks.canWorkOn:#alex
- tasks.canWorkOn:Everybody

Additional filter isInvolved:[memberName]
isInvolved is an additional filter that is only available for filtering but not for aggregation.
If you don't specify a memberName then the isInvolved filter will be applied to the current user session,
otherwise to the given memberName. The memberName of the role is the role name itself e.g. Everybody.
The memberName of a user is a hashtag # followed by the user name e.g. #alex.

Limitations:
- If you use the isInvolved filter for a user, then you can not specify a filter for creator.name, tasks.state, and tasks.worker.name.
- If you use the isInvolved filter for a role, then you can not specify a filter for tasks.state and tasks.responsibles.name.
- You can provide only one member (user or role).

e.g:
- isInvolved
- isInvolved:#alex
- isInvolved:Everybody

Escaping:
If you have values that contains whitespaces then you need to escape the value e.g. owner.name:"IT Manager"
If you want to use quotes within such values you need to escape them with " e.g. owner.name:"IT"Manager"

Business State OPEN.description: Aggregates only cases with business state OPEN.

Business State DONE or DESTROYED.description: Aggregates only cases with business state DONE or DESTROYED.

Start Timestamp older than 2020.description: Aggregates only cases which has started before 2020.

Business Runtime between 5 and 10.description: Aggregates only cases which has a Business Runtime between 5 and 10 seconds.

Business State Buckets.description: Aggregates cases by buckets of business state.

Start Timestamp Buckets.description: Aggregates cases by buckets of business state.

Start Timestamp Buckets and Business Sta.description: Aggregates cases by buckets of startTimestamp with the interval of 'month' with sub buckets of business state.

Average Start Timestamp.description: Average start time stamp of all cases.

403.description: The user does not own CaseReadAll permission

get.description: Deprecated instead use workflow/startables. Returns all process starts that can be started by the current user.
Returns all web startables that can be started by the current user.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Page size 1..n. Number of web startables per page

link.description: Links to the first, last, prev, and next page

total-size.description: The total number of web startables

400.description: If page or pageSize contains invalid values

head.description: Returns the total size of web startables that can be started by the current user.

total-size.description: The total number of web startables

parameters.name: agg
parameters.description:
The aggregation query to make bucket (grouping) or metric aggregations like average, max, min, or sum.
You can cluster tasks in buckets, as deep as you like, and optionally a metric as a terminal operation on such buckets.

${field1}:${operation1}:${payload1},${field2}:${operation2}:${payload2},${fieldX}:${operationX}:${payloadX}

All available fields:
- state (string)
- businessState (string)
- priority (string)
- category (string)
- isExpired (bool)
- worker.name (string)
- responsibles.name (string)
- originalResponsibles.name (string)
- businessRuntime (number)
- workingTime (number)
- numberOfResumes (number)
- startTimestamp (date)
- modifiedTimestamp (date)
- endTimestamp (date)
- expiryTimestamp (date)
- customFields.strings.* (string)
- customFields.numbers.* (number)
- customFields.timestamps.* (datetime)

Available operations for string fields:
- bucket

Available operations for bool fields:
- bucket

Available operations for datetime fields:
- bucket:interval (interval: year, month, week, day, hour [default: day])
- max
- min
- avg

Available operations for number fields:
- bucket:interval (interval: number [default: 1])
- max
- min
- avg
- sum

Limitations:
In a query,
- You can use a field only once.
- A metrics (avg, max, min, sum) needs to be the last operation.
- You can use one metric aggregation only once.

Result:
- A bucket contains always a 'key' and a 'count'. It may contain sub-aggregations with sub-buckets or metrics.
- A metric contains just a 'value' as a string.
- Datetime strings are always in ISO 8601 format e.g., 2023-02-15T13:06:42Z

Business State Buckets.description: Aggregates tasks by buckets of business state.

Start Timestamp Buckets.description: Aggregates tasks by buckets of startTimestamp with the default interval of 'day'.

Start Timestamp Buckets and Business Sta.description: Aggregates tasks by buckets of startTimestamp with the interval of 'month' with sub buckets of business state.

Average Start Timestamp.description: Average start time stamp of all tasks.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Filter to limit the tasks on which the aggregation is performed. You can
filter by multiple fields at once. Each expression is AND connected.

${field1}:${expression1},${field2}:${expression2},${fieldX}:${expressionX}

e.g.
- businessState:DONE,responsibles.name:#alex,numberOfResumes:>5

For string fields, you can use multiple values which (separated by a space) are OR connected, e.g.:
- businessState:DONE DESTROYED

You can make range filters for datetime and number fields with <, >, >= and <=. Datetimes must
be formatted in ISO 8601 format, e.g.:
- numberOfResumes:>5 <10
- numberOfResumes:>=5
- numberOfResumes:<=10
- startTimestamp:>2023-02-15T13:06:42Z

Additional filter canWorkOn:[memberName]
canWorkOn is an additional filter that is only available for filtering but not for aggregation.
If you don't specify a memberName then the canWorkOn filter will be applied to the current user session,
otherwise to the given memberName. The memberName of the role is the role name itself e.g. Everybody.
The memberName of a user is a hashtag # followed by the user name e.g. #alex.

Limitations:
- If you use the canWorkOn filter for a user, then you can not specify a filter for state and worker.name.
- If you use the canWorkOn filter for a role, then you can not specify a filter for state and responsibles.name.
- You can provide only one member (user or role).

e.g:
- canWorkOn
- canWorkOn:#alex
- canWorkOn:Everybody

Escaping:
If you have values that contains whitespaces then you need to escape the value e.g. canWorkOn:"IT Manager"
If you want to use quotes within such values you need to escape them with " e.g. canWorkOn:"IT"Manager"

Business State OPEN.description: Aggregates only tasks with business state OPEN.

Business State DONE or DESTROYED.description: Aggregates only tasks with business state DONE or DESTROYED.

Start Timestamp older than 2020.description: Aggregates only tasks which has started before 2020.

Number of resumes between 5 and 10.description: Aggregates only tasks which has been resumed between 5 and 10 times.

Business State Buckets.description: Aggregates tasks into business state buckets.

Start Timestamp Buckets.description: Aggregates tasks into business state buckets.

Start Timestamp Buckets and Business Sta.description: Aggregates tasks into startTimestamp buckets with the interval of 'month' and into business state sub-buckets.

Average Start Timestamp.description: Average start time stamp of all tasks.

GeoPositionBean.description: The geographic coordinate of the location

name.description: The name of the location, e.g., Zug, Wien

type.description: The type of the location, e.g., UserPosition, HeadQuarter, BranchOffice

address.description: The address of the location, e.g., Baarerstrasse 12;6403 Zug;Switzerland

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the location was created or updated
